data.name: Workout.GYM1.Notes
data.value: Tempo 3-1-1 = 3 seconds down – 1 second pause – 1 second up. RPE 7–9 for hypertrophy (1–3 reps in reserve). Brace your core as if preparing to be punched to protect your spine.

data.name: Workout.GYM1.Benefits
data.value: Build lower-body strength|Develop glutes and quads|Improve core stability|Increase calorie burn

data.name: Workout.GYM1.Step.warmup.Description
data.value:
3–5 minutes: incline walking or light cycling to raise body temperature.
2–3 minutes: - Glute bridge: 2 × 12 reps - Bodyweight squat: 2 × 10 reps
Ramp-up sets for the main lift: - 1 very light set × 10–12 reps - 1 moderate set × 5–6 reps

data.name: Workout.GYM1.Step.GYM1_STEP1.Description
data.value:
Target muscles: quadriceps, glutes, core.
Setup: - Feet shoulder-width or slightly wider, toes turned out 15–30° - Weight balanced over mid-foot - Neutral spine, chest open, eyes forward
Execution: - Inhale deeply and brace your core - Descend by pushing hips back while knees track over toes - Lower until you can maintain a neutral spine (thighs parallel is a common reference) - Drive up by pushing the floor away, keeping knees aligned
Coaching cues: - “Sit down as if onto a chair” - “Ribs down, core tight” - “Knees gently out”
Breathing: - Inhale at the top - Maintain brace during the descent and hardest point - Exhale near full extension
Recommended sets & reps: - Hypertrophy: 3–5 sets × 6–12 reps (RPE 7–9) - Strength: 4–6 sets × 3–6 reps
